intro: Trichodesma afghanicum, commonly known as Afghan glorybower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Trichodesma afghanicum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats.
